name: 謝東儒
objective: To familiarize the student with basic computer programming concepts. Topics cover the methods for analyzing problem statements, designing computer solutions, as well as an introduction into the syntax and semantics of the C and C++ programming language. An important objective of the course is to present effective methods of program design using modular construction and structured programming notions of sequence, selection, and iteration structures.
schedule:
1 Overview of Computers and Programming
2 Overview of C
3 Top-Down Design with Functions
4 Selection Structures: if and switch Statements
5 Repetition and Loop Statements
6 Modular Programming
7 Simple Data Types
8 Arrays
9 Midterm
10 Strings
11 Recursion
12 Structure and Union Types
13 Text and Binary File Processing
14 Programming in the Large
15 Dynamic Data Structures
16 Multiprocessing Using Processes and Threads
17 On to C++
materials: K. N. King, C Programming: A Modern Approach, 2nd Edition, W. W. Norton & Company, 2008.
